November 14, 2016

I picked this book up as a loaner with my Kindle Unlimited membership. I love, love, love dark stories that deal with captivity. The books that come with the long disclaimers, cautioning readers and warning of triggers, are usually my favorites. I'm twisted that way.

After reading the blurb for 'Broken: A Dark Romance', I thought I'd ran across a gold mine. Abduction. Sexual slavery. Organized crime. I was sure this would be a dark, gritty story that would keep me on the edge of my seat and have me chewing my nails down to the quick.

Unfortunately, it didn't happen. While this story did have some dark elements, it was watered down. I felt like the author wanted to be dark and edgy, but was afraid to cross that line and truly embrace that darkness. If you're a fan of dark reads, then you know the type.

Olivia Bell, our heroine, is abducted after she inadvertently stumbles upon a murder. She can't be set free after what she witnessed, so she is given to the murderer, Kane, to break. Of course, he happens to be an incredibly handsome guy that is in the business of breaking and training sex slaves.

Sounds dark, right? Well, if Kane hadn't been remorseful and sympathetic it might have been more believable. Top that off with Olivia's immediate and constant arousal in his presence, and it is hard to take this book seriously as a dark story.

Instead of being the edge of your seat story that I had craved, it ended up being a fluffy read with some kink. Less 'Captive In The Dark' and more BDSM Carebear, if you get what I'm saying. It was okay, but not what I thought I was signing on for.

Overall, it was a middle of the road type of book for me. It is a standalone and won't leave you hanging. However, if your looking for a dark romance/erotica that will make your pulse pound and the hairs on the back of your neck stand up, you won't find it here.

March 17, 2017

Now, I'm no writer, nor am I an expert on Stockholm Syndrome or capture-bonding, but I feel pretty confident in saying that if you're going to go with the whole victim falls in love with her kidnapper plot, one of two things needs to happen: 1) Lots of lots of time, or 2) some kind of psychological conditioning--usually a combination of the two. But, maybe that's just me. Even so, I find it a bit unbelievable (and ridiculous) that a woman can witness a brutal crime, get kidnapped, yet when she is finally face to face with the big, bad criminal, just "the deep cadence of his voice makes (her) pussy clench with sinful thoughts." Seriously? Why do they always get wet immediately?

Now I'm ignoring that I've read this exact premise before other than to say if I were the other author, I'd be super pissed...because dayum... Okay, moving on...

So, Kane is going to train Olivia to be his slave. He doesn't tell her he's undercover, but he does tell her that "things aren't quite what they seem to be." He explains that he just needs her to be perfect for him because their lives are in danger, but she can go home when it's all over. Oh, and shh--don't tell anyone. She agrees; let the training begin!

Things are progressing, but it's the weirdest training I've ever read--no sex, no punishment. Say what now?! He shows her around a BDSM mansion and makes her watch. She has this really weird freak out that makes zero sense:

"Do you know about BDSM or anything at all about Master slave relationships?" he asks.

"I know all about them. I've read about them in books..."

(Then later, when watching a submissive about to be paddled by her Dom along with several other people in attendance watching the show)

"It's a paddle. My heart races faster in my chest. He's going to beat her! My legs move naturally in an attempt to protest and save her... I can't stand by and watch this. I won't."

If she is so in the know because she's "read about them in books," this seems like a disproportionate reaction to watching a woman get her butt paddled, especially when her Dom prefaced it by announcing, "Tonight, my Sara will show her submission to me, and devotion to our lifestyle." Just saying...

The don't actually have sex until 60% in because he wants her to desire him, not just submit to him. He only "punishes" her once and it's by edging her. He does threaten to, then he says, "I changed my mind." And even though he changed his mind, she still says later, "he just punished me last time." Umm, no he didn't. And that's one of many, many problems.

Kane sits on the bed, and then he walks to the bed. Olivia searches a woman's face even though the woman's back is her. Olivia cries about Victor hurting her even though all he did was make her crawl, and on and on. It just didn't make any sense.

Then there was the gratuitous sex scene. Now normally I wouldn't complain about this, but Kane repeatedly says he'll never share her. "He said he'd protect me from them, and he'd be the only one to touch me. But as the two other Doms rise from their seats, he changes his tune and says, "Now would be the time to say no if you don't want this."

In the end, of course, you get your HEA as promised in the blurb. Then again, no cheating is promised too, and there is one scene that I suppose some people might argue...

I was thrilled to receive an Advance Reviewer copy of BROKEN by Willow Winters, because I am fan of her Valetti Crime Family series and think she is a very talented writer of bad boy mafia romances, but I am sorry to say that in my opinion this book did not quite live up to the promise of the premise

In a nutshell, Olivia Bell was at the wrong place at the wrong time and witnessed a brutal murder committed by the tall, dark and fearsome Kade Maddox (aka Master ), a nefarious criminal in the sex trafficking trade. He takes her captive, but in order to spare her life, he brokers a deal with the head ringleader to ‚Äúbreak‚Äù her and turn her into the ‚Äúperfect‚Äù slave. She is far from compliant at first, and fights tooth and nail trying to run away, forcing him to move her from his comfy home to a sinful brothel, home to sex slaves and their masters, where her intense, rigorous slave training will commence. But Kade is harboring some dangerous secrets and vows to protect her at all costs Although she knows it‚Äôs all kinds of wrong she is powerfully aroused by Master K‚Äôs training and finds herself falling head over heels for her captor. As the danger, desire and deceit reach a fever pitch, neither of them counted on the shocking turn of events that is about to implode both their worlds.

I REALLY wanted to like this book because it started out in a really thrilling and electrifying manner and I was excited at the prospect of diving into this dark master/slave tale where we see the hero's internal struggle between forbidding captor vs noble savior. But although I was drawn to the hot, sexy and breathtakingly tender master/slave dynamic between Kade and his ‚Äúsweet angel,‚Äù overall this book did not work for me. The author touted this as her first dark romance but it really wasn‚Äôt really all that dark‚Ä¶or compelling. Granted, it was well written and there were some really hot BDSM scenes but it lacked dramatic urgency and after a while I found myself skimming the sex scenes and slave training sequences because if felt very redundant.

On the positive side, I liked Kade... he was dark and domineering and fiercely protective, and was so exquisitely gentle and doting with Olivia it melted my heart. And his captive, Olivia, was sassy and fiery in the beginning and certainly gave him a run for his money. But once the training began, she became too passive for my taste. Turns out his plan to break her into complete submission worked TOO well. She spends practically the entire book doing his bidding and complying with his every demand out of fear of being punished, and the end result is she come across as weak and pathetic.

Another big problem I had with this book was that there was no genuine depth to this romance, or any real character development. This was very much a sexually-driven story that was heavy on the BDSM with a little drama and suspense thrown in. Pretty much the entire plot was focused on her slave training in the sex slave brothel and there was no real palpable love story here to make my heart race. The feelings that Olivia develops for her captor are truly a case of Stockholm Syndrome and little else. I never felt as if I got to really know Kade or Olivia on a personal level and they did not have much rooting value for me because I didn't connect emotionally with them as couple. And while their ‚Äúromance‚Äù (if you can call it that) had its sweet moments, their interactions lacked sparks, passion and genuine feeling, and the climax I felt to be quite anticlimactic and the HEA extremely rushed.

Overall, this book had an intriguing premise and had some steamy interludes and sweet tenderness, but it ultimately fell short on execution. But even though this particular book is a miss for me, I am still a fan of the talented Ms. Willow's work and will continue to read her books.

She doesn't know what being "trained" or "shipped off" means, but she has an idea and she knows she definitely doesn't want the last thing. She wants Kade to save her. She has this weird and wrong feeling that she can trust him that he will protect her and keep her safe.

Her instincts are spot on because Kade isn't what he appears, but I will NOT spoil that.

Either way, she is in a situation where she has to obey him. She struggles between her fantasies, her attraction to Kade, and the very real very wrong thing that's being done to her.

DARK-DANGEROUS-SENSUOUS ROMANCE

A titillating tale that is dark, dangerous and has action, suspense, tears, life-threatening incidents, loss, and sizzling obedient sensuous romance. The story makes you feel and keeps you turning the pages until the end. There are quite a few hurdles to conquer before the happy ever after.

Olivia thought the worst thing that could happen to her was getting thrown out of college due to drinking in the dorm. Walking alone at night, depressed and frustrated she finds herself in a dark alley and becomes an eyewitness to a murder. Taken by force she finds herself tied up in a shabby office with the men from the alley. The men who have taken her want her dead thinking she is worthless. This group of men is into sex trafficking and treat women like dirt. Kade an undercover cop is there to destroy their operation. In front of the boss he plays his part well pretending he can break any woman to submit to their master. Kade wreaks of power and is deadly. Truth be told he has been trained by the best. Kade is tasked to break her to prove his worthiness. Olivia fights him until she no longer can. He must break her to save both their lives.

The story is fast paced and brilliantly written. The author has mixed reality and fantasy which makes this story impressive. She also does not disappoint by giving readers an enthralling plot with fabulous dialogue and vivid scene descriptions that leave you breathless. It sickened Kade the things he made Olivia do, but keeping up the ruse was to protect her. Olivia truly was strong even when she submitted to Kade and followed his commands, but in the midst of all the chaos and pain, she fell in love. Kade never dreamed that he would fall in love and believed he was not worthy of Olivia's love. Their love story started in terror, but ended in devotion; let us not forget that Kade always gets what he wants. This was a gratifying read and the author did a fantastic job with the writing of this story; loved it. If you treasure dark romances, this is an excellent book for your library. In the world of fantasy romance, the magic begins with the first thought to paper. {I received an advanced reader copy of this story; I was not asked by anyone to do this review, it is done totally by my own choice alone}. Without reservations, I recommend this book.

I have only read one other book listed as a Dark Romance. This one has the other one beat by a mile! If you are considering reading this book, read a few of the reviews so that you know what you will be reading and can make an informed decision.

Olivia witnesses a gun shot murder in an alley. Beside the victim, there are three other really creepy bad guys in that dark alley, and one rather tall, imposing, handsome man who exudes power and control. Rather than have the young innocent killed there, too. He takes charge of her, promising to train her as a submissive to be sold into the sex trade. His name is Kade and we know right from the start that he is an undercover agent trying to bring down a large international sex ring. She can never know that piece of information.

Kade takes her to a gorgeous mansion, where other submissives and slaves are trained. Kade has participated in the BDSM scene, and is a DOM.

Olivia is a spitfire and is always looking for ways to escape.Submissiveness does not come easily to her, at least at first. Kade has to do some hard bargaining with her. The BDSM is very light. This is a psychological study of how Kade works with Olivia and sees her first as a duty and then increasingly as a love interest. She too eventually falls under his spell, but even late in the book is till looking for a way OUT..

There are a few other characters in the story, but they just fill out the story of the building romance between Olivia and Kade.

It's one of the best stories that I have read all year... and it is already December! I highly recommend this book.

This book is this author's darkest book to date. It wasn't the darkest I have read but it definitely took you out of your comfort zone. Our H is Kade Maddox and our h is Olivia Bell.

Olivia Bell had been expelled from college for drinking on campus. She has lost her scholarship and her parents support. While out one night after looking for a job, she takes an alley home instead of walking by some men. She ends up witnessing a murder and before she can get away, she is captured. When she comes to, she is being given to the man that shot the other man.

Kade Maddox isn't everything that he seems. He comes off as a cold hearted killer that likes to break and train women. Kade is actually undercover and is there to take down the sex trafficking ring. Once he sees Olivia, he knows he has to take her to save her life. He will also have to break her to save his cover.

Olivia fights Kade but feels drawn to him at the same time. He is actually Master K and introduces Olivia to BDMS. As their time goes on, Kade hates having to put Olivia through what he is but he is doing it to save her life. He also needs to save his cover so he can bring down the operation.

Olivia and Kade's chemistry was off the charts and the sexy scenes were hot. This wasn't in the top of some of my darker reads (as far as the dark) but it was for what I have read by this author. You can easily see her growth as an author from her first book to this one. I, for one, can't wait to see what she is going to write next.

I voluntarily reviewed an Advance Reader Copy of this book.

October 11, 2016

Olivia Bell is a young college student that's been expelled from college for underage drinking. Olivia is looking for a way to support herself and pay rent now that she doesn't have a job any more. Olivia is overlooked for the jobs she's applying for. Then Olivia witnesses something that she shouldn't only to have her world turned upside down where nothing is ever the same again. Kade Maddox isn't even his real name yet he's so far undercover that defies logic. The rules are do nothing illegal ever no matter what but sometimes the rules aren't any good at all. Now Kade has to figure out a way to make things right for Olivia even if she never understands. Kade promises Olivia freedom but can he really grant it? Your answers await you in Broken.

I love Ms. Winters writing style! The story and characters are compelling, complex, real, gritty, raw, honest, and flawed in their own way. I'm definitely looking forward to my next adventure with this author.
